title._content: Foot Race at Keene Driving Park, Keene NH

description._content: TITLE Foot Race at Keene Driving Park, Keene NH CREATOR SUBJECT Sports & recreation facilities - NH - Keene Parks - NH - Keene Spectators - NH - Keene DESCRIPTION Photograph of a foot race held at the Keene Driving Park, now Edgewood Park, in Keene New Hampshire around 1905. "In July 1875, the grounds of Keene Driving Park were opened to the public. A trotting course was constructed measuring just over a half-mile in length and a grandstand built which seated 1,500 spectators. Agricultural shows and races were held here for a number of years, also circuses and in 1912 the first airplane demonstration in Keene. By the time this scene was photographed, about 1905, the trolley line had been extended to service the Driving Park. Development into a residential section took place after 1913; the name Edgewood was suggested...in a contest." Edgewood was probably Keene's first housing development and is located on the southeast side of Lower Main Street. The old race track forms the course for the street around the common in the center of the development. PUBLISHER Keene Public Library DATE DIGITAL 20080324 DATE ORIGINAL 1905? RESOURCE TYPE photographs FORMAT image/jpg RESOURCE IDENTIFIER hsykmsc011 RIGHTS MANAGMENT No known restriction on publication.
